results.name: Number of divisors d of n such that A323243(d) is odd; number of terms of A324813 larger than 1 that divide n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
formula: a(p^k) = 1, for all primes p and exponents k >= 1.
program: A156552(n) = {my(f = factor(n), p2 = 1, res = 0); for(i = 1, #f~, p = 1 << (primepi(f[i, 1]) - 1); res += (p * p2 * (2^(f[i, 2]) - 1)); p2 <<= f[i, 2]); res}; \\ From A156552 by _David A. Corneth_
(PARI) A324825(n) = sumdiv(n,d,A323243(d)%2); \\ This needs code also from A323243.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 16 2019
